title: How Benjamin Netanyahu became the leader of the 'civilized world'
description: The 'war on terror' Netanyahu has been preaching continuously for four decades is imposing its ideological muscle memory on Western democracies.

title: Mob storms Russian airport, looking for Jewish passengers from Israel
description: An airport in Russia’s Muslim southern region closed after hundreds stormed the tarmac and climbed onto planes on the evening of Sunday, October 29, 2023. The governor of Dagestan promised that those responsible for the incident would be punished.

title: COP28: In Dubai, migrant workers toiled under extreme heat to get climate conference facilities ready in time
description: According to an investigation by the British NGO FairSquare, the ban on working during the hottest hours of the day was not respected –  just a few months before the summit to fight global climate change.

title: Pope Francis attempts to instill a new culture in the Catholic Church
description: At the end of the synod intended by the pontiff to be an assembly at the service of everyone, a report was drawn up which raises the possibility of ordaining women deacons.

title: Beijing embarrassed by mass youth unemployment
description: Unemployment is at an all-time high among China's youth, despite numerous job shortages. With higher levels of education than previous generations, they are more reluctant to work in factories.

title: Erdogan, the enduring reinterpreter of Turkish history
description: The Turkish president, who celebrated the 100th anniversary of the Republic on October 29, is reviving sultans and strongmen, while relying on a dramatization of the national narrative. He aligns characters and events with his ideological vision in a neo-Ottoman-inspired bid for renaissance.

title: The scourge of drone deliveries to French prisons
description: Criminal networks are increasingly using remote-controlled drones to deliver goods such as knives, cell phones and drugs to inmates. This practice is causing concern for French prison authorities.

title: Harry in his little navy polo shirt: Does anyone care?
description: On October 22, Prince Harry attended the Formula 1 Grand Prix held on the Circuit of the Americas in Austin, Texas. It was an opportunity to see that, at 39, his highness is chasing his youth.

title: Sunak and Macron stress need for urgent humanitarian aid in Gaza
description: The two leaders 'agreed to work together on efforts both to get crucial food, fuel, water and medicine to those who need it, and to get foreign nationals out,' Downing Street said in a statement on Sunday.

title: 'The Jews of France are no more responsible for Israeli policy than the Arabs of France are for Hamas terrorism'
description: Transposing the Israeli-Palestinian  to an already fragmented country poses a very real danger of further fuelling anti-Semitism and racism, warns columnist Philippe Bernard.

title: Elon Musk, the disinformed disinformer
description: In just one year, the Tesla and SpaceX boss has transformed Twitter into X, a social media network where fake news proliferates. But he himself is a victim of this ecosystem, with his naiveté and credulity shining through it.

title: With the death of Matthew Perry, 'Friends' loses its Chandler Bing
description: Deliberately funny and ironic about his own weaknesses, weakened by his addictions to alcohol and painkillers, the actor marked the cult series with his impeccable sense of comic timing. He died on October 28 at the age of 54.

title: Macron plans to make abortion an 'irreversible' constitutional right in France
description: In an online post on Sunday, the French president said, 'In 2024, the right of women to choose abortion will become irreversible.'

title: Rugby World Cup 2023: South Africa remains on top of the world after nerve-wracking final
description: The Springboks triumphed over New Zealand 12-11 on Saturday. A victory by the slimmest of margins, it made Siya Kolisi's team the most successful in history.

title: Striking US auto union reaches tentative deal with Stellantis
description: The agreement reached Saturday after 44 days of strike action that simultaneously targeted Detroit's "Big Three" automakers, is similar to one struck earlier this week with Ford, the union said. GM now remains the only automaker without a tentative deal

title: In Poland, after their surprise victory, the democrats prepare for a tense coalition with President Duda
description: The future majority will have to re-establish the rule of law and the country's credibility on the European stage. To be enacted, all legislative initiatives, apart from the budget vote, require the signature of the president, a member of the ultra-conservative party.

title: Israel-Palestinian peace: What is the two-state solution?
description: Israel and Palestine as two independent states, coexisting side by side − this was the principle of the Oslo Accords, signed in 1993 by then-Israeli PM Yitzhak Rabin and Yasser Arafat, former chairman of the Palestine Liberation Organization. But since the agreements' failure, some consider this solution unrealistic.

title: Turkey's centenary celebrations overshadowed by war between Israel and Hamas
description: Often accused of wanting to replace the figure of Mustafa Kemal Atatürk, President Recep Tayyip Erdogan has prioritized support for Gaza over national celebrations. Hundreds of thousands of people attended a large rally in support of Palestine on Saturday in Istanbul.

title: 'Friends' actor Matthew Perry dies aged 54
description: Law enforcement sources told the 'Los Angeles Times' that the star was found unresponsive in a hot tub at his Los Angeles home by first responders on Saturday. They were unable to revive him.

title: Tyson Fury wins split decision against MMA fighter Ngannou
description: Mixed martial arts fighter Francis Ngannou knocked Fury down in round three but the 35-year-old British fighter, though shaken, was able to continue. He remained undefeated at 34-0-1 with 24 knockouts.

title: Netanyahu says Gaza war has entered 'second stage'
description: Casting the war as a fight for his country's very survival, the Israeli prime minister warned Saturday that the assault would intensify ahead of a broad ground invasion into Gaza. The health ministry in the Hamas-ruled territory said early Sunday that more than 8,000 had been killed in Gaza since the start of the war.
